text.text: How do I add a new benefit plan in ZOLL Billing?

text:
To add a new benefit plan in ZOLL Billing, follow these steps:

1. Log in to the ZOLL Billing system.
2. Click the "Benefit Plans" tab.
3. Click the "Add New Benefit Plan" button.
4. Enter the following information:
    * Benefit plan name
    * Benefit plan type
    * Benefit plan start date
    * Benefit plan end date
    * Benefit plan cost
5. Click the "Save" button.

text.text: What is a benefit plan in ZOLL Billing and how is it tied to a policy?

text: A benefit plan is tied to a insurance policy type. For example, a Preferred Provider Organization (PPO) benefit plan could be tied to a policy type of commercial.

text.text: How can I add reimbursement rates for a benefit plan in ZOLL Billing?

text:
Reimbursement rates are administered in the Allowable Amounts section.

To enable rolling into the base rate, follow these steps:
1. Click Admin > Billing > Payers
2. Click the payer name
3. Click the Policies tab
4. Click the Enable rolling into base rate checkbox
5. Click Save & Close

To edit the schedule, click the Edit pencil icon

text.text: Explain the significance of allowable amounts in ZOLL Billing's benefit plans.

text: An allowable amount is the dollar amount that an insurance will reimburse for a service or procedure.

text.text: How do I associate an allowable amount with a benefit plan in ZOLL Billing?

text: To apply an allowable amount to a plan, select the allowable amount name from the drop-down menu when you click the Apply an allowable amount field.

text.text: What details do I need to provide when creating a new benefit plan in ZOLL Billing?

text: When you add a policy / plan , you need to provide the following information: 1. Plan name 2. Policy type 3. Reimbursement rate

text.text: Can you guide me through adding a new policy type to a benefit plan in ZOLL Billing

text: To add a new policy type to a benefit plan, you need to: 1. Select a policy 2. Click Continue 3. View the " New benefit plan " page 4. Provide the following information: Plan name, Policy type, Reimbursement rate.

text.text: How do I edit an existing benefit plan in ZOLL Billing?

text: To edit an existing benefit plan, you need to: 1. Click the edit pencil 2. Make the necessary changes 3. Click Save.

text.text: What steps should I follow to enable or disable a benefit plan in ZOLL Billing?

text: To enable a benefit plan, you need to: 1. Click the dash under the Enabled column 2. The dash will change into a check mark to indicate that the plan is now enabled. To delete a benefit plan, you need to: 1. Click the X under the Delete column.

text.text: How can I delete a benefit plan that is no longer needed in ZOLL Billing?

text: To delete a benefit plan, you need to: 1. Click the X under the Delete column. 2. If you delete a plan that has been applied to an open claim, the system will still process the claim normally but you will not be able to add this plan to new claims.

text.text: Explain the purpose of the Mileage rounding field in ZOLL Billing's benefit plans.

text: The Mileage rounding field in ZOLL Billing's benefit plans allows you to determine how you apply mileage rounding. You can round up/down, or use fractional mileage. This field is used to accommodate payer requirements.

text.text: Can you clarify the options available for mileage rounding in ZOLL Billing?

text: The options available for mileage rounding in ZOLL Billing are:. Do not round (fractional). Round down .5. Round down always. Round up.5. Round up always. Use fractional mileage. You can choose to round mileage up, down, or use fractional mileage to accommodate payer requirements.

text.text: How do I save changes to a policy or plan in ZOLL Billing after modifying mileage rounding settings?

text: To save changes to a policy or plan in ZOLL Billing after modifying mileage rounding settings, you need to: 1. Click the Mileage rounding field and then select to round up/down or use fractional mileage. 2. When you are done configuring the policy/plan, click Save & Close.

text.text: Benefit Plans

text: A benefit plan details what is covered by the insurance for the group or individual's health care. A benefit plan is tied to a insurance policy type. For example, a Preferred Provider Organization (PPO) benefit plan could be tied to a policy type of commercial. There can be multiple benefit plans associated with a single policy type. Because the benefit plan is tied to the policy, selecting a policy is the first thing you do after you click Add a benefit plan.

text.text: Benefit Plan Field Definitions?

text: When you click the Select a policy for this benefit plan field, the system displays all the policies you have configured in the drop-down menu. You select a policy and then click Continue to view the "New benefit plan" page.

text.text: Allowable Amounts

text: An allowable amount is the dollar amount that an insurance will reimburse for a service or procedure. This is different than the amount on the Charges page. The amount entered in this section is the amount the insurance will pay while the amount entered on the Charges page is the amount your company charges. The payer's allowable amount may impact the amount your company charges.

text.text: Plan Details

text: Plan values take precedence over the same value type entered for the policy and the payer.

text.text: What is Electronic filing indicator?

text: An electronic filing indicator is used on ANSI 837 and ANSI 837P (Professional) standard format to electronically transmit health care claims.

text.text: What is Timely filing claims?

text: Timely filing is when an insurance company restricts the number of days in which you can submit a claim. Each payer will set their own timely filing. For example, if Aetna has a 90-day timely filing requirement, you must submit the claim within 90 days of the date of service.

text.text: What is Timely filing appeals?

text: Timely filing appeals is the amount of time the insurance company allows for a claim appeal.

text.text: what is Provider ID?

text: A provider ID is a payer-specific number assigned to your organization and may be your tax ID. If unknown or not assigned, leave blank.

text.text: How to override provider ID?

text: If you need to override the provider ID, ZOLL provides two options, 24J RenNPITax ID and 24J RenProvNum -Blank.

text.text: what is clearing house fields can you provide with examples

text: Each clearinghouse has their own Payer ID list and every single payer transaction is assigned an ID. For some payers the Payer ID is the same for a claim, an eligibility check, and a remittance. For others, the claim and remittance identifiers are same but the eligibility identifier is different. Not to confuse things, but you may find cases where the claim, eligibility, and remit identifiers are all unique.

text.text: give me examples for  clearing house fields?

text: Examples of clearinghouse fields include: United Healthcare's Payer ID is 87726. No unique Payer IDs are listed for remits and eligibility so you would enter the same Payer ID for all three clearinghouse fields (claim, eligibility, and remittance). Medicaid of Louisiana's Payer IDs are SB670 for claims, Z1050 for remittance, and SKLA05 for Eligibility. Community Care's Payer IDs are 73143 for both claims and remits, and 00448 for Eligibility.

text.text: What is mileage rounding?

text: Mileage rounding is the process of rounding the mileage number up, down, or not at all (fractional). You can set the mileage rounding for patients who are primary or self-pay payers. You can also set the mileage rounding for a policy or plan.

text.text: what is Sequestration?

text: Sequestration is a mandatory 2% payment reduction in the Medicare FFS Program. You can select an option from this field to regulate how the system applies sequestration.

text.text: How to Disable/Enable a Benefit Plan

text: To disable a benefit plan, click the check mark under the Enabled column. To enable a benefit plan, click the check mark under the Enabled column.

text.text: How to delete a benefit plan?

text: To delete a benefit plan, click the X under the Delete column. If you delete a plan that has been applied to an open claim, the system will still process the claim normally but you will not be able to add this plan to new claims.

text.text: what is Mileage - fractional or rounding

text: When reporting mileage, you can round the number up, down, or not at all (fractional).

text.text: How to modify an existing policy or plan:

text: To modify an existing policy or plan, you can click Payers on the navigation bar, scroll through the list and click the insurance name, click the policies tab, click the Mileage rounding field and then select to round up/down or use fractional mileage.
